course_title: Topics: Historical Analysis: African American Urban History
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 25 / Seats Avail: 25Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same AAS 285 4)


A survey course designed to introduce students to major issues related to African American urban history since 1945. This course focuses on the social, economic, and political forces that have shaped, and reshaped, the lives of Black people in U.S. cities from World War II to the present. Course topics include: (im-)migrations, suburbanization, social movements, policing, mass incarceration, consumerism, and urban culture.
course_description: An introductory course on the nature and methods of history. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
